isis.stitle: TSI 96-14-01RA - Axilok® Unitized Self-Locking Wheel Bearing Adjusting Nut

subjectgroup.subject: Axilok® Unitized Self-Locking Wheel Bearing Adjusting Nut

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or death, do not install the Axilock nut on any axle not built with it or on any vehicle built by International before June 1, 1996. Inappropriate use of the Axilock nut could result in a "wheel off" condition.

geninfo.para: International vehicles with 23,000-30,000 lb. single rear axles and 38,000-58,000 lb. tandem rear axles may have the Axilok unitized self-locking wheel bearing adjusting nut ( Figure 1). The Axilok unitized design enhances accurate, reliable wheel bearing adjustment. Its unitized self locking nut design allows precise wheel bearing adjustment making it easy to achieve end play settings of .001 inch to .005 inch which provides for improved wheel seal and bearing life and meets the requirements of antilock brake systems.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Axilok Unitized Self-Locking Wheel Bearing Adjusting Nut

geninfo.para: The Axilok unitized design is easy to install. Place a 4 inch 6 point socket over the hex portion of the nut to release the locking clips. This allows the nut to rotate freely within the retaining cage. When the socket is removed and the locking clips are engaged in the locking holes in the retaining cage, the Axilok adjusting nut is locked securely in place.

svcproc.title: SOCKET SELECTION AND MAINTENANCE
svcproc.para: A 4 inch 6 point socket is required to depress the locking clips for the installation and removal of the Axilok wheel bearing adjusting nut.

important.para: Always use the correct socket. Do not use any other type of instrument to depress the locking clips such as pliers, channel locks, etc.

svcproc.para: Be certain the socket is not worn or damaged to the point it will not fully depress the locking clips or properly engage the hex nut feature.
Always use a properly calibrated torque wrench when installing an Axilok adjusting nut assembly.

caution.para: Never use an impact wrench or other power tool to install or remove an Axilok nut assembly.

step1.para: Place the 4 inch socket over the hex portion of the nut to depress the locking clips ( Figure 2). Make sure the socket is pushed on over the nut until it contacts the retaining cage. This insures the locking clips will be disengaged and will not be damaged during disassembly.

figure.caption: Figure 2. Place Socket Over Hex Portion of Nut

step1.para:
Turn the nut counterclockwise to remove. Keep forward pressure on the socket to keep the locking clips disengaged from the retaining holes.
When removing the Axilok adjusting nut assembly, it is required to manually keep the retaining cage moving toward the end of the spindle with the nut as the nut is removed ( Figure 2). DO NOT FORCE! If any binding occurs in the removal process, reverse to tightening direction for 1/4 turn, then continue in the removal direction. Repeat this step as necessary. DO NOT FORCE!

caution.para: Before re-installing the Axilok nut, be certain the threads, locking tab, locking clips and retaining cage are free of any damage or defects and are in proper working condition.

step1.para: Clean the spindle threads and keyway thoroughly with a wire brush to avoid a false bearing adjustment reading ( Figure 3).

figure.caption: Figure 3. Clean Spindle Threads and Keyway With a Wire Brush

important.para: Be sure the keyway slot is free of any burrs and defects ( Figure 4).

figure.caption: Figure 4. Be Sure Keyway Slot is Free of any Burrs and Defects

step1.para: Bearings must be pre-lubed before installation. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the proper lube specifications.
Apply a few drops of light weight lubricating oil through one of the holes of the retaining cage. This will allow the nut to rotate freely during installation ( Figure 5).

The nut and retaining cage of the Axilok nut assembly are locked together with two locking clips ( Figure 1). Place the 4 inch 6 point socket over the hex feature of the nut to depress the locking clips, thereby releasing the locking clips and allowing nut to rotate freely within retaining cage ( Figure 6).

figure.caption: Figure 6. Nut Retaining Cage and Tab

step1.para:
Align the tab on the retaining cage with the keyway in the spindle ( Figure 6). Thread the nut onto the spindle with the socket ( Figure 7). Keep forward pressure on the socket to keep the locking clips disengaged from the retaining holes.
Make sure the retaining cage goes on freely not catching on the axle shaft threads.

figure.caption: Figure 7. Thread Nut onto Spindle With Socket

step1.para: After wheel hub, bearings, and Axilokunitized self locking nut are installed, rotate the hub assembly while tightening the self locking nut to 200 ft-lbs. (271 Nm).
Back off Axilokunitized self locking nut to zero torque.
Rotate the hub assembly a minimum of one complete revolution while retightening the Axilok unitized self locking nut to 50 ft-lbs. (68 Nm).
Back off the Axilok unitized self locking nut 1/8 turn.

Remove the socket from the Axilok nut allowing the spring clips to release and engage into the holes in the retaining cage. Visually, and/or with your finger, inspect to make sure the locking tabs are lined up with the retaining cage holes.
If the tabs of the locking clips do not line up with the holes, rotate the Axilok nut counterclockwise until the locking clips engage into locking holes ( Figure 8).

figure.caption: Figure 8. Rotate the Axilok Nut Counterclockwise Until the Locking Clips Engage

svcproc.title: WHEEL BEARING END PLAY CHECK AND ADJUSTMENT

svcsubproc.title: Procedure
svcsubproc.para: This procedure is done with the vehicle on floor stands.

step1.para: Use a dial indicator to measure hub end play ( Figure 9) with respect to the axle tube (spindle) with axle shaft not installed. It is also recommended that the tire assembly not be installed.

figure.caption: Figure 9. Mount Dial Indicator to Hub

step1.para: Remove axle shaft if installed. Mount the dial indicator to the hub as illustrated in Figure 9. Grasp assembly at the 3 o'clock and 9 o'clock position. While rotating the assembly, first push, then pull evenly on the assembly to measure the amount of end play. Note total indicator reading.

The bearing adjustment procedures are intended to result in .001 to .005 inch (.0254 to .127 mm) end play with no preload. It may be necessary to tighten or back off the Axilok to obtain the correct amount of end play. Refer to Fine Tuning The Adjustment (Incremental Adjustment) below.

svcsubproc.title: Fine Tuning The Adjustment (Incremental Adjustment)
svcsubproc.para: The Axilok retaining cage ( Figure 1) has a number of locking holes that each represent a value of adjustment. See the Incremental Adjustment Value Chart for the incremental measurement value.

para.emph: No. of Slots in Retaining Ring

svcsubproc.para: Once an adjustment setting has been achieved, a fine tuning of the end play adjustment can be obtained.

step1.para: Place the 4 inch socket over the hex feature of the nut to depress the locking clips ( Figure 10).

figure.caption: Figure 10. Place Socket Over Hex Feature of Nut

step1.para: To decrease end play, rotate the Axilok unitized wheel bearing adjusting nut in a clockwise direction to the next hole(s) (example: from .004 inch to .002 inch of end play).
To increase end play, rotate the Axilokunitized wheel bearing adjusting nut in a counterclockwise direction to the next hole(s) (example: from .001 inch to .003 inch of end play).

When the wheel bearing adjustment is complete, remove the socket from the Axilok nut allowing the locking clips to release and engage into the locking holes in the retaining cage. Visually and/or with your finger, inspect to make sure the locking tabs are lined up with the retaining cage holes.
If the tabs of the locking clips do not line up with a retaining cage hole, rotate the Axilok nut COUNTERCLOCKWISE until the spring clips engage into the locking holes.
Verify new end play setting with a dial indicator. Refer to steps 2 and 3 under WHEEL BEARING END PLAY CHECK AND ADJUSTMENT.

caution.para: Failure to follow these procedures may result in serious damage to the spindle or result in wheel end failure.

svcsubproc.para: The axle adjusting nut allows for a precise wheel bearing adjustment. With this in mind the wheel bearing end play should be kept in the range of the .001 inch - .005 inch specification. This will provide longer wheel bearing life.
